result.execSummary:
The defendant Susan J. Fullerton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

This sentence is to be served CONSECUTIVE to the sentence in 15CT123
--WITH Huber privileges

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Susan J. Fullerton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from JCSD advising huber has been revoked
Time to Pay / Payment Extension Reminder

Cases 15CM127 and 15CT123 called together at 4:05pm [mo]
[Both Cases are Scheduled for FSSC]
Defendant Susan J. Fullerton in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Count #1 of Case 15CM127 and Count #2 of the Amended Criminal Complaint of Case 15CT123; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1 of Case 15CT123.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--Atty. Svehlek submits Defendant's exh. #1 (letter from Madison Health Services)-offered and received

On Count #2  of the Amended Criminal Complaint of Case 15CT123, the Court sentences the Defendant: 

--To serve  6 months   in the Jefferson County Jail, WITH Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served,with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process
--To pay fine of $600+ costs= $1,694(incl. DNA surcharge) + $56.74 in blood testing fees to JESO = $1,750.74 is to be paid in $30 per month installments, commencing on  4/15/2016 and on the 15th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 35 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive

The Court orders outright:
--Revocation of drivers license for 27 months
--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 27 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

On Count #1 of Case 15CM127, the Court sentences the Defendant:
--To serve  2 months   in the Jefferson County Jail, WITH Huber privileges; this sentence is to be served CONSECUTIVE to the sentence in 15CT123
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served,with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge is to be paid in $30 per month installments, commencing at the conclusion of payment plan in case 15CT123; non-payment will result in 9 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive

As to Case 15CM127: 0 days served 
As to Case 15CT123: 0 days served 
recess: 5:01pm

Cases 15CM127 and 15CT123 called together at 10:02am [mo]
Defendant Susan J. Fullerton in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance in both files 
As to the State's 8/4/15 Motion for Joinder of Crimes for Trial:
--no objection from Defense
--The Court signs proposed Motion for Joinder 


The Court orders that the FSSC and Jury Trial for 15CM127 be removed from the calendar and then both cases, due to joinder of cases have FSSC and Jury Trial on the dates aforeset in 15CT123.
recess: 10:07am

NEXT: For both Cases: (1) FSSC on 9/15/15 at 3:00pm (2) Jury Trial on 9/17/15 at 8:30am
Notice of Motion and Motion for Joinder of Crimes reviewed by Court's JA

Cases 15CM127 and 15CT123 called together at 8:43am [mo]
Defendant Susan J. Fullerton in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance in both files
Atty. Svehlek indicates a resolution has not been met at this time, despite meetings with the State, further she indicates that Ms. Fullerton has a pending OWI charge in another county and requests another status date.
The Court declines this request and schedules these matters for Trial.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. The Court indicates that each of these files will need its own Trial date. DA Happ indicates that the analyst for the CT case is available on September 17th.
The Court disperses its scheduling order to the parties.
recess: 8:50am


NEXT: In Case 15CT123: (1) FSSC: September 14, 2015 at 3:00pm (2) Jury Trial: September 17, 2015 at 8:30am 
           In Case 15CM127: (1)FSSC: August 24, 2015 at 11:00am (2) Jury Trial: August 27 OR 28, 2015 at 8:30am
Status conference on July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 2:46pm.; related case #15CT123 is later called also at 2:52pm. 
Defendant Susan J. Fullerton in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Initial Appearance is held in Case #15CM127:
---Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
---Service of Complaint admitted, reading is waived.
---The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
---Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.
---The Court requires $1,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--to remain absolutely sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescription medications as prescribed

The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Ms. Fullerton on multiple cases; then-DA Wambach may have appeared for the State in hearings in those cases. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
recess 2:56pm. 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/10/15 at 9:20am (2)  Status Conference on 7/7/15 at 8:30am (the 5/26/15 Status Conference in related case #15CT123 is to be moved to this same date/time)
